title: Introduction to Haki
content: Haki is a mysterious power in the world of One Piece that allows the user to utilize their spiritual energy for various purposes.

children.title: What is Haki?
children.content: Haki is a latent ability found in every living being, often unlocked through intense training or experience.

children.title: Origin of the Term
children.content: The term 'Haki' translates to 'ambition' or 'willpower,' highlighting its internal, mental nature.

children.title: Historical Use of Haki
children.content: Before the term was formalized, powerful figures in history unknowingly used Haki in battle.

children.title: Role in the One Piece World
children.content: Haki plays a vital role in high-level combat and can match or even surpass Devil Fruit powers.

children.title: Used by the Yonko
children.content: Characters like Shanks, Kaido, and Big Mom are masters of Haki, using it to dominate the seas.

children.title: Types of Haki
children.content: There are three main types of Haki, each with unique properties and combat applications.

children.title: Observation Haki
children.content: Allows the user to sense the presence, emotions, and even the future movements of others.

children.title: Advanced Forms
children.content: Some users can see seconds into the future, as seen with Katakuri in the Whole Cake arc.

children.title: Armament Haki
children.content: Cloaks the user's body or weapon in a force that can bypass Devil Fruit defenses.

children.title: Internal Destruction
children.content: An advanced stage where the Haki penetrates and damages targets from within.

children.title: Conqueror’s Haki
children.content: A rare type that grants the ability to exert willpower over others and knock them unconscious.

children.title: Clash of Kings
children.content: When two users of Conqueror’s Haki clash, it can physically split the sky.

children.title: Training and Mastery
children.content: Haki mastery requires rigorous physical and mental training, often in life-or-death scenarios.

children.title: Rayleigh’s Training of Luffy
children.content: Luffy learns all three types of Haki under Rayleigh’s guidance during the two-year time skip.

children.title: Use in Post-Time Skip Battles
children.content: Luffy begins using Haki proficiently against strong opponents like Doflamingo and Kaido.

children.title: Haki vs. Devil Fruits
children.content: Haki is one of the few forces in One Piece capable of countering the abilities of Devil Fruits.

children.title: Bypassing Logia Intangibility
children.content: Armament Haki allows users to touch Logia-type users who are otherwise intangible.

children.title: Examples from the Series
children.content: Luffy uses Haki to punch Caesar Clown and bypass his Gas-Gas Fruit intangibility.
